assignment.title: W.E Theory Assignment #1
assignment.university: University Of Engineering and Technology Taxila

question: Select three different websites from one category and give a feature comparison of these three websites. Feature comparison should be related to functionality. A category can be like, educational, social networking, online shopping, online selling.

websites.name: Amazon
websites.primary_purchase_model: Fixed Price (Buy Box). The default is a simple 'Add to Cart' and 'Buy Now' for a set price, often sold by Amazon itself or a third-party seller.
websites.seller_base_inventory: Mass-market retailers and individuals. A vast mix of everything from major brands (via Amazon or their official stores) to small businesses and individual sellers using Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA).
websites.search_discovery: Algorithm-driven (A9). Highly personalized based on your browsing/purchase history. Strong filters for brand, price, Prime eligibility, and customer ratings.
websites.checkout_fulfillment: Unified Cart & Advanced Fulfillment. You can add items from different sellers into one cart and check out once. Amazon's key feature is FBA/Prime, offering fast, often free, shipping from Amazon's warehouses.
websites.key_unique_feature: Amazon Prime Ecosystem. Functionality is deeply integrated with Prime benefits: fast shipping, Prime Video, Prime Gaming, etc. Subscribe & Save is another unique function for recurring deliveries.

websites.name: eBay
websites.primary_purchase_model: Auction & Fixed Price. A core functionality is the ability to bid on items in a timed auction. 'Buy It Now' is also a common fixed-price option.
websites.seller_base_inventory: Individuals and businesses. A huge range from people selling single used items from their home to large liquidators and retailers selling new products in bulk.
websites.search_discovery: Keyword and filter-heavy. Powerful filters are essential due to the variety of conditions (new, used, refurbished) and sellers. 'Best Match' algorithm considers price, shipping, and seller history.
websites.checkout_fulfillment: Seller-Managed Checkout. You often check out per seller. Shipping methods, costs, and speeds are set by each individual seller. No unified cart across different sellers.
websites.key_unique_feature: The Bidding/Auction System. The ability to place a bid, set a maximum bid, and be notified if you're outbid is a core, defining function not found on the other two platforms.

websites.name: Etsy
websites.primary_purchase_model: Exclusively Fixed Price. All items are listed at a set price for direct purchase. The focus is on handmade, vintage, and craft supplies.
websites.seller_base_inventory: Individual artists and small studios. The platform is restricted to sellers offering handmade goods, vintage items (20+ years old), and craft supplies.
websites.search_discovery: Community and aesthetic-focused. Search is geared towards categories like jewelry, home decor, and wedding items. Strong emphasis on visual search and filtering by item attributes (color, occasion, theme).
websites.checkout_fulfillment: Seller-Managed Checkout. Similar to eBay, you purchase directly from one shop/seller at a time. Shipping is handled individually by each artist/seller.
websites.key_unique_feature: Handmade/Vintage Marketplace Focus. Exclusively for handmade items, vintage goods, and craft supplies with strong community features for artists and buyers.
